item.title: Introduction to Perl
item.description: In this article you will learn about some important aspects of the Perl programming language. This is a first contact with characteristics that make up the language. Perl Features — Important Aspects of the Language Perl is one of the most popular and feature-rich programming languages ​​on the market. It has been developed and improved for over two decades. It has an active and participatory community in its development. Perl can run on an insane amount of platform.

item.title: Setting Up the Perl Development Environment
item.description: In this tutorial we are going to install Perl and everything else necessary to start programming in this language. To program in Perl it’s necessary to install the programming language distribution application and a simple text editor. Strawberry Perl — What is it and how to download it Strawberry Perl is a Perl development environment for Microsoft Windows. Strawberry Perl contains all the requirements needed to run Perl scripts. Strawberry Perl can be downloaded directly from the official website https://strawberryperl.

item.title: Developing the First Program in Perl
item.description: Perl scripts are plain text. Despite its simplicity, Perl scripts can perform complex tasks. First, create a folder called perl-scripts in the C: root directory. Open your favorite text editor to create the first Perl script. Create a new file and enter the code below: #!/usr/bin/perl use warnings; print("Hello, World!\n"); Save the file with the name HELLO.PL to the perl-scripts folder. Running a script in Perl To run a Perl script, open a command prompt in Windows.

item.title: Perl - Operators
item.description: Perl operators are symbols that represent a specific operation to be performed on one or more operands. Operators are used in expressions, which are statements that use values and operators to produce a value. Operators are a hugely important part of programming. They tell your computer what you want it to do with a given input. Numeric operators Perl has a variety of numeric operators to help you manipulate numbers, including arithmetic, Boolean, and bitwise operations.

item.title: Perl - List
item.description: A Perl list is a data type that can store an ordered sequence of values. A list is composed of items, called list elements. Each list element is a set of values, and these values are indexed and ordered. Example: () (1, 2, 3) ("Perl", "Programming", "Code") (4, 5) (1, "hi") ("hi", 1, 2, "bye") Simple Perl list Complex Perl list Flattening lists in Perl Flattening list in Perl is a process of converting nested lists to single-level lists.
